definition.value: This is an AE which is a rare hemorrhagic diathesis, with clinical symptoms similar to those associated with the inherited form von Willebrand disease and  syndrome is characterized by a lack of previous bleeding symptoms, negative familial history, and occurrence in a relatively older age.
This is an AE which is small, reddish brown or even flesh-colored, smooth, shiny, 0.1 to 0.3 cm papules present over the sides of the nose and the medial portions of the cheeks.

This is an AE which is a mature T-cell lymphoma of blood or lymph vessel immunoblasts characterized by a polymorphous lymph node infiltrate showing a marked increase in follicular dendritic cells (FDCs) and high endothelial venules (HEVs) and systemic involvement.
This is an AE which is the most common benign tumour of the kidney.
This is an AE which is a rare and aggressive cancer that starts in the endothelial cells that line the walls of blood vessels or lymphatic vessels.
This is an AE which is a central component of the reninâ€“angiotensin system (RAS), which controls blood pressure by regulating the volume of fluids in the body.
This is an AE which is the creation of new blood vessels in the choroid layer of the eye.
This is an AE which is any disease that has the connective tissues of the body as a target of pathology.
This is an AE which can be arbitrarily divided into micro- and macrovascular complications, the major microvascular complications being nephropathy, retinopathy and neuropathy.

This is an AE which is an extremely rare autoimmune condition that causes inflammation of small and medium-sized blood vessels (vasculitis) in persons with a history of airway allergic hypersensitivity (atopy).
This is an AE which is the rupturing (lysis) of intravascular red blood cells (erythrocytes) and the release of their contents (cytoplasm) into surrounding fluid (e.g. blood plasma) .
This is an AE which is a rare, benign tumor. It may mimic an angiosarcoma, with lesions that are red or purplish 5-mm to 5-cm papules and deep nodules on the head, neck, or upper extremities.

This is an AE which is the natural formation of new iris blood vessels (neo- + vascular + -ization), usually in the form of functional microvascular networks, capable of perfusion by red blood cells, that form to serve as collateral circulation in response to local poor perfusion or ischemia.

This is an AE which is a rare anatomical variant in which the aortic arch is on the right side rather than on the left. During normal embryonic development, the aortic arch is formed by the left fourth aortic arch and the left dorsal aorta.
This is an AE which occurs late after the modified Fontan procedure is frequently associated with low output states, supraventricular arrhythmias, and atrial thrombus formation.
This is an AE which is a form of cardiomegaly, or heart enlargement.

This is an AE which may can result in a lack of emotional prosody or intonation when speaking. Right hemisphere damage also has grave effects on understanding discourse and  have a reduced ability to generate inferences, comprehend and produce main concepts, and a reduced ability to manage alternative meanings.

label.value: right ventricle outflow tract obstruction AE

definition.value: This is an AE which is defined as a peak echo-Doppler gradient at least 30 mmHg across the right ventricular outflow tract (RVOT) and included any postoperative surgical or percutaneous interventional procedure to address any right-sided outflow obstruction.
This is an AE which is an accepted indication of ASD closure  and several studies have reported that transcatheter ASD closure results in RV remodeling and exercise capacity improvement .
This is an AE which is a form of cardiomegaly, or heart enlargement.
This is an AE which is a condition defined by an abnormal enlargement of the cardiac muscle surrounding the right ventricle.
This is an AE which is an abnormal, congenital heart murmur caused by subaortic stenosis (SAS).
This is an AE which is a congenital obstructive narrowing of the aorta just above the aortic valve and is the least common type of aortic stenosis.
This is an AE which has been defined by Abbot as a condition in which the arterial vessels in the greater circulation remain abnormally small.
This is an AE which is the thickening, hardening, and loss of elasticity of the walls of arteries on aortic.

This is an AE which is the abnormal sound generated by turbulent flow of blood in an aortic artery due to either an area of partial obstruction or a localized high rate of blood flow through an unobstructed aortic bruit artery.
This is an AE which refers to the widening of luminal diameter in aortic blood vessels.
This is an AE which could interfere with the classification of TEVAR complications.
This is an AE which clotted blood which lines most aortic aneurysms can break off and result in an embolus.
This is an AE which due to aortic thrombosis is a rare condition which is often life-threatening. and occurs most commonly in individuals who are predisposed to cardiovascular diseases.
This is an AE which is the rupture or breakage of the aorta, the largest artery in the body.
This is an AE which is the narrowing of the exit of the left ventricle of the heart (where the aorta begins), such that problems result.
This is an AE which refers to the calcification in and around the aortic valve can progress and extend to involve the electrical conduction system of the heart in calcific aortic stenosis.
This is an AE which is the increase in the volume of anaortic wall due to the enlargement of its component cells.
This is an AE which is the inflammation of the aortic walland the disorder is potentially life-threatening and rare.
This is an AE which is a congenital condition whereby the aorta is narrow, usually in the area where the ductus arteriosus (ligamentum arteriosum after regression) inserts.
This is an AE which is where the capillaries, usually of the legs or lungs, are inflamed.
This is an AE which is a small blood vessel from 5 to 10 micrometres (Î¼m) in diameter, and having a wall one endothelial cell thick and its may become disorder.
This is an AE which might be a useful clinical sign for screening Zika virus infection.
This is an AE which is a combination of both myocarditis and pericarditis appearing in a single individual, namely inflammation of both the pericardium and the heart muscle.
This is an AE which is an abnormal dilatation of pericardium of the heart.

This is an AE which is a pathological wound healing on the pericardial in which connective tissue replaces normal parenchymal tissue to the extent that it goes unchecked, leading to considerable tissue remodelling and the formation of permanent scar tissue.
This is an AE which is a medical condition characterized by a thickened, fibrotic pericardium, limiting the heart's ability to function normally.
This is an AE which is inflammation of the pericardium (the fibrous sac surrounding the heart)and may be caused by viral, bacterial, or fungal infection.
This is an AE which is inflammation of the pericardium (the fibrous sac surrounding the heart)caused by meningococcal.

This is an AE which is a form of pericarditis and caused by tuberculosis is difficult to diagnose, because definitive diagnosis requires culturing Mycobacterium tuberculosis from aspirated pericardial fluid or pericardial biopsy, which requires high technical skill and is often not diagnostic (the yield from culture is low even with optimum specimens).
This is an AE which is a localised infection of the pericardial space associated with purulent pericardial fluid.
This is an AE which is inflammation of the pericardium (the fibrous sac surrounding the heart).

This is an AE which occurs by direct infection during trauma, thoracic surgery, or catheter drainage, by spread from an intrathoracic, myocardial, or subdiaphragmatic focus, and by hematogenous dissemination.
This is an AE which is a restriction in blood supply to brain stem  tissues, causing a shortage of oxygen that is needed for cellular metabolism (to keep tissue alive).
